page.title: 04SUMMER FARMING AT CARSPHAIRN
page.content: {CLIPPING}At the beginning of June the hog clipping starts.(Hogs are last year's lambs).Most farms clip with electric shears, although sometimes hand clippers are used. Each fleece is rolled up and put into a tall sack. Someone gets into the sack and stamps the wool down.When the hogs have been clipped, they are buisted. (That means that they are marked with keil).The keil shows where the hogs belong on the farm.The tups are clipped next and their wool is put into a different sack.In July the ewes are clipped. {DIPPING}Dipping at this time of year is compulsory, and takes place during July and August.The sheep are dipped to prevent scab, as well as blow flies and keds. {INOCULATIONS}During the year the sheep are inoculated against various diseases.
